message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the environmental impact of cars. As cars are driven, they emit greenhouse gases, such as carbon dioxide, which contribute to global warming. This can lead to an increase in daily temperatures. Option (B) is incorrect because there is no direct relationship between car usage and bird health. Option (C) is unrelated because the purification of water is not directly influenced by car usage. Option (D) is unrelated because there is no direct relationship between car usage and the taste of food.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the effects of car emissions on the environment. When cars are driven, they release carbon dioxide and other pollutants into the atmosphere. These pollutants contribute to climate change and can cause an increase in daily temperatures. Option (B) is incorrect because there is no direct link between car driving and bird sickness. Option (C) is unrelated because water purification is not directly affected by car driving. Option (D) is unrelated because there is no direct link between car driving and the taste of food.

Option (D) is unrelated to the topic and does not make logical sense in relation to driving cars.
